page.title: 03Sports Centre - Cockermouth
page.content: Opened in 1978 by Princess Alexander, the Centre now comprises a 25m by 8m swimming pool and faclities for indoor cricket, keep-fit classes, volleyball, weight training with a multi-gym, solarium and a sauna. Before the Centre was opened public sports facities were very limited. Improvements planned include an all-weather pitch for football, netball, basketball and hockey. The swimming pool was built as a result of intensive fund-raising by Cockermouth people over several years. Allerdale District Council built the pool with a grant from the Sports Council and money given by the Cockermouth Swimming Pool Association. The C.S.P.A. formed the nucleus for the successful Cockermouth Swimming Club which competes both locally and nationally.
